title: Displacement graph from velocity time graph

content.question: The graph above shows the velocity v as a function of time t for an object moving in a straight line. Which of the following graphs shows the corresponding displacement x as a function of time t for the same time interval?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with v on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Four evenly spaced tick marks are on the horizontal axis to the right of the origin on each graph. In choice A, a curve is plotted starting at the origin and increasing and concave down until the first tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from the tick mark meets the curve. The curve then becomes horizontal until the third tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from that tick mark meets the line. The line then becomes a curve that is decreasing and concave down until reaching the horizontal axis at the fourth tick mark.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with v on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Four evenly spaced tick marks are on the horizontal axis to the right of the origin on each graph. In choice B, a curve is plotted starting at the origin and increasing and concave up until the first tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from the tick mark meets the curve. The curve then becomes horizontal until the third tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from that tick mark meets the line. The line then becomes a curve that is decreasing and concave up until reaching the horizontal axis at the fourth tick mark.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with v on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Four evenly spaced tick marks are on the horizontal axis to the right of the origin on each graph. In choice C, a curve is plotted starting at the origin and increasing and concave down until the first tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from the tick mark meets the curve. The curve then becomes a straight line that is increasing linearly until the third tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from that tick mark meets the line. The line then becomes a curve that is increasing and concave up until the fourth tick mark.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with v on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Four evenly spaced tick marks are on the horizontal axis to the right of the origin on each graph. In choice D, a curve is plotted starting at the origin and increasing and concave up until the first tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from the tick mark meets the curve. The curve then becomes a straight line that is increasing linearly until the third tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from that tick mark meets the line. The line then becomes a curve that is increasing and concave down until the fourth tick mark.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with v on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Four evenly spaced tick marks are on the horizontal axis to the right of the origin on each graph. In choice E, a curve is plotted starting at the origin and increasing and concave down until the fourth tick mark. Dashed vertical lines from the first and third tick marks meets the curve.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with v on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Four evenly spaced tick marks are on the horizontal axis to the right of the origin on each graph. In choice D, a curve is plotted starting at the origin and increasing and concave up until the first tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from the tick mark meets the curve. The curve then becomes a straight line that is increasing linearly until the third tick mark, where a dashed vertical line from that tick mark meets the line. The line then becomes a curve that is increasing and concave down until the fourth tick mark.
